page.title: 09ADVERSANE CARAVAN PARK
page.content: In order to stop gypsies and other travellers parking their vans in lay-bys etc off main roads, local Councils were required to establish permanent sites. One such was provided six years ago on the western side of the A29, half a mile south of the hamlet of Adversane The park, which is well screened from the road, has a permanent utility block and plots for twelve caravans. Each plot has a metered electricity supply. Although intended to serve itinerent travellers, most of the present occupiers live permanently on the site. One plot is occupied by a council appointed warden who breeds dogs as well as managing the site. Other occupants are scrap metal dealers, horsebreeders and casual labourers. Children attend the local school.
